intro: Pimpinella bobrovii, commonly known as the Bobrov's cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbrella-shaped inflorescences, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Pimpinella bobrovii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments.
